data_structure.description: Chinese profanity database with Simplified/Traditional characters and pinyin romanization

entry_format.traditional: Traditional Chinese character version if different
entry_format.severity: Severity level (1-4) adjusted for Chinese cultural context
entry_format.variations: Character variations, abbreviations, and romanized forms
entry_format.target_type: Whether it targets individuals, groups, or is general
entry_format.regional_usage: Mainland China, Taiwan, Hong Kong specific usage patterns
entry_format.dialect_specific: If specific to certain Chinese dialects

cultural_context.face_culture: Chinese culture heavily emphasizes face-saving (面子) and avoiding public shame
cultural_context.confucian_values: Confucian hierarchy and filial piety make family attacks particularly severe
cultural_context.harmony_ideology: Social harmony values make direct confrontation taboo
cultural_context.internet_censorship: Mainland Chinese internet has extensive profanity filtering systems
cultural_context.regional_differences: Significant differences between Mainland, Taiwan, Hong Kong usage

words.context_notes: Common mild expletive, literally 'mother's', often used for emphasis
Strong profanity meaning 'fuck', commonly used as intensifier
words.regional_usage: Mainland China and Taiwan, less common in Hong Kong

words.context_notes: Strong profanity attacking someone's mother, very offensive
words.regional_usage: Universal but considered more offensive in traditional contexts

words.context_notes: Calling someone a 'stupid cunt', combines intelligence and sexual insult
words.regional_usage: Very common online, especially among younger users

words.context_notes: Internet meme euphemism for 'fuck your mother', sounds like alpaca (羊驼)
words.regional_usage: Mainland China internet culture, censorship evasion

words.context_notes: Calling someone an 'idiot' or 'moron', moderate insult
Mild insult meaning 'stupid egg' or 'dummy', often used playfully
words.regional_usage: Universal, relatively mild across all regions

words.context_notes: Death threat meaning 'go die', extremely serious
words.regional_usage: Universal but taken very seriously culturally

words.context_notes: Calling someone a 'beast' or 'animal', dehumanizing insult
Extremely derogatory term for women meaning 'whore' or 'bitch'
Male genitalia reference, also used as intensifier meaning 'awesome'
words.regional_usage: More common in Southern China and Hong Kong

words.context_notes: Literally 'dog shit', used to describe something worthless
Derogatory term for Japanese people, historically loaded
Extremely derogatory term for foreigners, especially Japanese
Calling someone extremely ugly, appearance-based insult
Class-based insult meaning 'poor ghost' or poverty-shaming
words.regional_usage: Universal but particularly sensitive in inequality contexts

words.context_notes: Derogatory term for nouveau riche, 'new money' criticism
words.regional_usage: Universal, especially relevant in modern China
Urban areas looking down on rural people

words.context_notes: Calling someone 'mentally ill' or 'crazy', ableist language
words.regional_usage: Universal but increasingly recognized as problematic
Common online but increasingly recognized as hate speech

words.context_notes: Ableist slur for intellectual disability, extremely inappropriate
words.regional_usage: Universal but recognized as hate speech

words.context_notes: Homophobic slur for gay men, highly offensive
words.regional_usage: Common in Hong Kong and Southern China

words.context_notes: Homophobic slur combining death wish with gay slur
words.regional_usage: Common online, mixing Chinese and English

words.context_notes: Extremely derogatory sexual term for women meaning 'slut'
Extremely derogatory term meaning 'loose woman' or 'slut'
Extremely vulgar and misogynistic term, 'stinking whore'
Traditional insult meaning 'turtle egg', implies illegitimate birth
Sichuan dialect insult meaning 'turtle son', implies cuckoldry
Calling someone a 'rabbit spawn', implies cowardice
Calling someone 'lowly person' or 'cheap person', class-based insult
Derogatory term meaning 'cheap goods', often targeting women
Calling someone a 'dead pervert' or sexual deviant
Calling someone a 'sex wolf' or sexual predator
Calling someone a 'bastard' or 'scoundrel', moderate insult
Calling someone a 'bastard' or 'mongrel', attacks family legitimacy
words.regional_usage: Universal but very offensive to family honor

words.context_notes: Calling someone 'wild seed', implies illegitimate birth
Extremely offensive combining animal and illegitimacy insults
Calling someone 'human scum' or 'dregs of society'
Calling someone a 'stupid pig', intelligence and character attack
Mild insult calling someone 'pig head', often used playfully
Calling someone having a 'pig brain', intelligence attack
Calling someone a 'dog thing', dehumanizing insult
Calling someone a 'running dog' or lackey, political insult
Extremely serious accusation of being a 'traitor to the country'
words.regional_usage: Universal but extremely serious political accusation

words.context_notes: Historical term for Chinese traitor, extremely serious accusation
Derogatory term for pro-government internet commenters
Voluntary pro-government commenter, political internet slang
Grass radical used to evade censorship for 操 (fuck)
More explicit character for 'fuck' than 操
Fuck your mother - explicit variant with rare character
Fuck your mother - extremely offensive family honor attack
Idiom for 'stupid' or 'good for nothing', literally '250'
Dumb cunt - combines stupidity and vulgarity
Fuck - Taiwan variant, traditional character distinguishes from 'dry'
Fuck your mother - extremely offensive variant
River crab - homophone for 和谐 (harmony), refers to censorship
Male genitalia - variant spelling of 鸡巴
Old fart who won't die - ageist insult
Extremely vulgar sexual slur for women
Variant spelling of 傻逼 (stupid cunt)
Euphemistic spelling of 傻逼 (stupid cunt)
Grandson - used as insult implying submission
Little devils - derogatory for Japanese (variant of 鬼子)
Vagina - clinical but can be vulgar in context
Show off - literally 'pretending to be a cunt'
Fuck your mother - extremely offensive in Cantonese (diu2 nei5 lou5 mou5)
Fall on the street and die - Cantonese curse (puk1 gaai1)
Curse on your whole family - extremely offensive Cantonese (ham6 gaa1 caan2)
Variant of 冚家鏟 - curse on family (haam4 gaa1 caan2)
Breast - can be vulgar in context
Your mother is dead - extremely offensive internet abbreviation
Holy shit - euphemism for 我操
Euphemism for 妈了个逼 (mother's cunt)
Raised by a dog mother - family honor attack
Traitorous running dog - compound political insult
Sell out country for personal glory - traitor
Hong Kong independence - politically loaded term
Public intellectual - derogatory for liberal critics
White left - derogatory for Western liberals
Go to your mother's - dismissive curse
Roll your mother's egg - elaborate curse
You count as a fart - you're worthless
Fart your mother's fart - bullshit curse

words.pinyin: gǒu gǎi bù liǎo chī shǐ
variations: gou gai bu liao chi shi
words.context_notes: A dog can't stop eating shit - leopard can't change spots
Go to hell - literally 'go see ghosts'
Fuck your mother - Hokkien/Taiwan variant (kan lim nia)

words.pinyin: gàn nǐ zǔ zōng shí bā dài
variations: gan ni zu zong shi ba dai
words.context_notes: Fuck your ancestors eighteen generations - extreme family curse
Fuck your mother's cunt - Taiwan extreme profanity
Worse than an animal - extreme dehumanization
Creative grass radical variations for censorship evasion
Little devil - can refer to children or enemies
Dead ghost - affectionate or insulting depending on context
Stupid dick - Cantonese compound insult (ngong6 gau1)
Useless - literally 'waste firewood', Cantonese common (fai3 caai4)

homophone_substitution.description: Using characters with similar pronunciation to evade filters

examples.草泥马: cǎo nǐ mā (fuck your mother) sounds like alpaca
examples.河蟹: hé xiè (river crab) sounds like 'harmony' (和谐), referring to censorship

visual_similarity.description: Using visually similar characters or symbols

examples.艹: Grass radical used instead of 操 (fuck)
examples.屮: Sprout radical as euphemism for profanity

abbreviations.description: Using first letters or abbreviated forms

emoji_substitution.description: Using emojis or symbols to represent characters

examples.🐴的: 马的 (horse's) instead of 妈的 (mother's)
examples.🌿你🐎: 草你马 using grass and horse emojis

romanization_note: Uses standard Pinyin romanization with tone marks. Tone-neutral romanizations included in variations for practical usage.
